doc.field: In principio erat verbum, & verbum In biginning worde it was, And Ã¾e worde at gode it vas, And god him selue Ã¾e worde was he, Ã¾at is and euer more schal be. At god it was in biginning, Ã¾orou him is maked alle Ã¾ing, With outen him is maked noght, Euer yiet Ã¾at might be oght, Ã¾at made in him his lif was riht, Atte lif was mannes light, And light in merkenes Ã¾at shines bright, And mirkenes it vmbilappene miht. A Man fro god was sende, hight Iohn; He comes in wittnes sone on an, To giue witnes of Ã¾e light Ã¾orou him Ã¾at alle sulde truwe it riht. He was noght liht, bot, for to wisse, Ã¾urgh wittnes of Ã¾e light Ã¾at isse, Right light was Ã¾at lightes al Man come in to Ã¾is werld Ã¾at schal. In werld he was in flex and blode, Ne was none Ã¾at him vndirstode; And al Ã¾e werld Ã¾orou him is wroght, And te werld ne knew him noght. In til his oven he come with blis, Ã¾ai keppe him noht, Ã¾o Ã¾at wore his. Ã¾o Ã¾at keppe him dai or niht, Ere in er?e he gaf hem miht, Als godes sones to be Ã¾e same Til alle Ã¾at liuen in his name, Ã¾at nouht of blodes Ã¾ai be-gan Ne of will of flex ne of wil of man; Bot of god Ã¾en are Ã¾ai born, Ã¾at is and euer was bi-forn, And worde in flex made right And woned in vs Ã¾orou godes miht. And we Ã¾e blisse of him sal se, Als blis Ã¾at euermore sal be, Of oneli sone fadir Ã¾at es fful of happe and sothefastnes. Amen. II. Missus est angelus Gabriel. In Ã¾at time, als was ful wel, Sende is Ã¾e aungel Gabriel ffro god in til a cite, Hat Nazareth in Galile, Un to a Maiden wedded riht Til a man, whos name hight Iosep of Ã¾e house of Daui, And name of Ã¾e maiden Mari. And when Ã¾e aungel was in gon, Vnto hire he saide onon: âHaile ful of hape, god is with Ã¾e, In wemmen blissed Ã¾ou be!â When Ã¾at sho hade herde Ã¾isse, In his sagh drofede sho isse, And sho soght for bi anni Ã¾ing, What Ã¾at miht be Ã¾is hailsing. Ã¾en saide Ã¾e angel witerli To hir Ã¾at was so hali: âMari, drede Ã¾e noÃ¾ing nou, For hape at gode funden has tou. Loke, in wombe on-fong Ã¾ou mon, And for Ã¾i salt tou bere a son, And Ã¾ou salt kalle his name Iesus, ffor god wil Ã¾at it be Ã¾us. SwiÃ¾e mekel sal he be, And son of heighest be kald sal he, And louerd sal giue him Ã¾er with Ã¾e sete of his fadir hous Dauid, And in Iacob hous rike sal he, And of his rike no ende sal be. Vnto Ã¾e aungel saide Mari: âHou mai Ã¾is be? no man knaw I.â And ansuerd Ã¾e angel bright, He saide to hire was ful of miht: âÃ¾e hali gaste sal come in Ã¾e al, And miht and heighest inshadw Ã¾e sal, And forÃ¾i Ã¾at heli born of Ã¾e, Godes sone be kalde sal he. And loke, Elizabeth, Ã¾i nece vn-welde, Onfonges a son in hir elde, And Ã¾is moneth sext til hire is yhit, Gelde unberand Ã¾at kald is it. ffor vnimiht sal noght be At god, no worde I sai to Ã¾e.â Ã¾en seide Mari with milde chier: âGodes handemaiden lo me here! Als tou has saide, so mot it be After thi worde vnto me!â III. Cvm natus esset Iesus in Bedelem. When Ã¾at Iesus was born yhing In daies of Erode Ã¾e kyng, Lo, kynges of oÃ¾er lande, Ã¾ai come to Iherusalem saiand: âWhore is Ã¾at t[i]l vs born is he, King of Iues sal be? In Ã¾e est his stern we se, And to bidde him come we.â Herand Herod droued is Ã¾o, Al Iherusalem with him als so. And princes of prestes kalland al And maistre writers of s[c]ole men kal, Of Ã¾am yhornlie spired he, Whore Ã¾at Crist born miht be. âIn Bethelem Iudeâ, saide Ã¾o, âÃ¾urght prophete is it writen so: And Ã¾ou Bethelem, land of Iude nou, Noht litel in princes of Iude ert Ã¾ou, ffor fro Ã¾e Duk come sal Ã¾ai wel, Stere sal mi folk of Irael. Ã¾en Herode kalland Ã¾e kynges stilli, Of Ã¾am spired he bisili Ã¾e time of Ã¾e sterne so briht Ã¾at to Ã¾am shewes dai and niht. And in to Bethelem Ã¾am sendand, He saide with mikel niht and and: âGoos and spires hardeli Of Ã¾e child ful witerli! And when Ã¾at ye haue funden hit, Again to me Ã¾en do ye wit, Ã¾at I mi selfe mai come with al, And to him biseke I sal.â When Ã¾at Ã¾ai Ã¾e kyng had herde, fforth opon Ã¾ar wai Ã¾ai ferde. And lo, Ã¾e sterre while Ã¾ai seghe, Bifore Ã¾am wited apon heghe, Whil Ã¾at comand stille it stode, Ã¾ar was the childe in flesshe and blode. And Ã¾ai, seand Ã¾e sterne so, With mikel gladschip glade are Ã¾o, And Ã¾e heli hous incomand With Mari, his Moder, Ã¾e child Ã¾o fand. And Ã¾ai be-soght him dounfalland And Ã¾ar bordes openand. [G]iftes to him bede Ã¾ai Ã¾ore, Golde, Recles, Mirre wel more. And awnsuerd in drem takand Ã¾o Ã¾at bi Herode noght sulde Ã¾ai go, Hamward bi a noÃ¾er wai In to Ã¾aire rike went are Ã¾ai. IV. In illo tempore Recumbentibus. In Ã¾at time and in Ã¾at lande Ellefe disciples wore sitand, And Iesus to Ã¾am shewed he, Ã¾at louerd is and ai sal be, And vpbraided mistrouht of Ã¾o And hardnes of hert als so, ffor to Ã¾o Ã¾at segh him rise Walde Ã¾ai noht liue on no kin wise. And to Ã¾am he saide on hand: âIn alle Ã¾e werlde yhe be goand, And Ã¾e ewangel spelle yhe Til alkyn creature mai be. And Ã¾at trowes and cristend isse, Sal be sauf til heuen blisse, And Ã¾at leues noght for thi, Sal be fordone witerli. Ã¾hese tokenes Ã¾at liuen right, Sal filihe Ã¾am bi dai and niht. In the name min deuelnesse Sal Ã¾ai out kest fro more and lesse; With new tunges speke sal Ã¾ai, Neddres sal Ã¾ai do a-wai; And if dedlic dronken haue Ã¾ai oght, To Ã¾am dere sal it noht; Apon seke lai sal Ã¾ai hende, And wel sal Ã¾o haue and amende!â When Ã¾at soghlic louerd Iesus Hade spoken in til am Ã¾us, Vptan he is in heuen briht And sites on godes halue riht. Ã¾ai sothelic forth yhode spelland Ouer alle in ilka land, God wirkand and sagh festenand With tokenes Ã¾at wore filihand. Amen. Q vicumque vult saluus esse. Who so wil be sauf to blis, I Before alle Ã¾inges nede it is Ã¾at he hald with alle his miht Ã¾e heli trauth and leue it riht. Whilk bot ilkon to queme II Quam nisi quisque Hole and wemles it yheme With outen drede bes Ã¾er forn ffro godes sight in ai forlorn. Sothelic Ã¾e heli trauht Ã¾is isse, III Fides autem Ã¾at .o. god in Ã¾rinnesse And Ã¾rinnes in onnesse Wurchip we Ã¾e more and lesse. Bot of fadir and son and heli goste VI Sed patris et filii On is godes coningue, Ã¾at is moste; Heuen blis is til am Ã¾re, Ai .on. in mikelhede to be. Whilk Ã¾e fader, whilk Ã¾e son, VII Qualis pater, talis Whilk heli gost wil with am to wun. Vnshapen fadir, unshapen son is, VIII Increatus pater Vnshapen heli gost in blis. Mikel fader, mikel son ai, IX Inmensus pater Mikel heli goste niht and dai. Ailastand fadir, ai-lastand son, X Eternus pater, eternus filius Ailastand heli [gost] be mon. Als so al-mihtand fader, almihtand son, XIII Similiter omnipotens Al-mihtand heli goste to wun. And Ã¾owheÃ¾er noht [Ã¾re] al-mihtand, XIV Et tamen non tres Bot on. almihtand is liuand. Als so god fadir, god sone isse, XV Ita deus pater, deus God hali gost with am in blis. And Ã¾owheÃ¾ere noht godes Ã¾hre, XVI Et tamen non tres Bot on is god and ai sal be. XVII Ita dominus pater XVIII Et tamen non tres ffor als sengellic hode god oure louerd to be XIX Quia sicut Ã¾urght cristen sothenes lette sal we, To Ã¾re godes or louerdes to kall Ã¾urght heli festnes forboden ar all. Ã¾e fadir of non made is he, XX Pater a nullo est Ne shapen ne kinned to be. Ã¾e sone of onli fader blis XXI Filius a patre Noht shapen ne made, bot kinned is. So Ã¾at bi alle, als bifore saide is, XXV Ita vt per omnia And Ã¾rinnenes in onnes, And onnesse in Ã¾rinnes ai Are to wurschip niht and dai. God of kinde, of fader kinned werld bi-forn, XXIX Deus est ex substancia Man of kind, of moder in to werld born. ffulli god, fulli man liuand, XXX Perfectus deus Of schilful saule and mannes flesshe beand. Veni creator spiritus. 1 Cvm, maker of gaste Ã¾ou ert, Veni creator Ã¾ouhtes of Ã¾ine Ã¾ou seke and hert, Of heiest hape fulfild in quert Ã¾e brestes Ã¾at Ã¾ou make gert. 2 Whilk Ã¾ou art saide maker of gle, Qui paraclitus Gaste of god heiest is he, Welle, quicfire, and charite, And gosteli seruise, Ã¾e best mai be. 3 Ã¾ou seuen-fold of gifte Ã¾at isse, Tu septifor[mis] Of god rihthand Ã¾ou finger is, Ã¾ou righwis hote of fadir blis, Righthand Ã¾rotes with worde Ã¾ou wisse. 4 Kyndelik in wittenes for to wende, Accende In-yiet loue in hertes hende, Ã¾e vnmigh of oure bodi oure Ã¾ou mende, festenand. 5 A-wai Ã¾ou fleme oure fo, Hostem And pais Ã¾ou gif vs sone als so, Ã¾e leder so be-fore to go, Ã¾ar dering alle we fle Ã¾er fro. 6 Ã¾e fadir, gif, we with Ã¾orou Ã¾e Per te sciamus And knowe Ã¾e sone als so Ã¾e se, Ã¾e hali gaste of lyÃ¾e wil beâ In al time we trowe Ã¾ise tre. 7 Whilum ful mani a haleghed brest Dudum sacra[ta] With Ã¾i hape Ã¾ou fild and fest; For-giue sinnesâÃ¾at is bestâ And times giue of ro and rest. 8 To Ã¾e fadir ante sonne be louyng maste Sit laus And to Ã¾e heli rouere with chaste, Til vs Ã¾e sune he sende on haste Giftes of Ã¾e heli gaste.
